introCallout.title: Campus safety: Emergency phones
introCallout.text: Keep an eye out for the blue emergency phones around campus. If you press the button, you’ll be connected directly to University Police Dispatch.

tours.name: Highlights Tour
tours.description: Academics, student life, dining, and wellness — no housing stops.

stops.title: Student Services Building
stops.subtitle: One Stop + key student support
stops.description: Home to One Stop Student Services for financial aid, billing, transcripts, registration, and enrollment questions. Also includes EOP, DPRC, Counseling & Psychological Services, and other essential support offices.
stops.address: Student Services Building, San Francisco State University

stops.title: Ethnic Studies & Psychology Building
stops.subtitle: Equity, identity, social justice
stops.description: Houses the College of Ethnic Studies — the first of its kind in the nation — and the Psychology Department. Programs explore identity, equity, social justice, and human behavior.
stops.address: Ethnic Studies & Psychology Building, San Francisco State University

stops.title: Burk Hall
stops.subtitle: Nursing + classrooms
stops.description: Home to Nursing and other academic programs, classroom space, faculty offices, and academic resources. Many students take courses here throughout their time at SFSU.
stops.address: Burk Hall, San Francisco State University

stops.title: Gymnasium
stops.subtitle: Athletics + Kinesiology
stops.description: Supports Athletics and Kinesiology with indoor courts, fitness and training areas. Outside near Don Nasser Family Plaza is the Ally Gator Spirit Statue — a favorite photo spot.
stops.address: Gymnasium, San Francisco State University

stops.title: Thornton Hall
stops.subtitle: Science & Engineering + Planetarium
stops.description: Home to the College of Science & Engineering with lecture halls, labs, and the campus Planetarium. Students across STEM majors complete foundational coursework here.
stops.address: Thornton Hall, San Francisco State University

stops.title: Hensill Hall
stops.subtitle: Biology + life sciences
stops.description: Houses Biology and life science programs with teaching and research labs supporting hands-on scientific learning. Popular for STEM and pre-health pathways.
stops.address: Hensill Hall, San Francisco State University

stops.title: Science & Engineering Innovation Center
stops.subtitle: Modern labs + project-based learning
stops.description: Supports engineering and applied sciences with collaborative labs and modern research spaces designed for hands-on, project-based learning.
stops.address: Science & Engineering Innovation Center, San Francisco State University

stops.title: Health & Social Sciences (HSS) Building
stops.subtitle: Wellness + social impact careers
stops.description: Houses programs like Public Health, Social Work, and other community-focused disciplines. Encourages interdisciplinary collaboration and prepares students for impact-driven careers.
stops.address: Health & Social Sciences Building, San Francisco State University

stops.title: Lam Family College of Business
stops.subtitle: Career readiness + FogCam
stops.description: Supports majors like Finance, Marketing, Accounting, and Management with advising and career development resources. Inside is the SFSU FogCam — wave toward the windows and check it live at fogcam.org.
stops.address: Lam Family College of Business, San Francisco State University

stops.title: Administration Building & Undergraduate Advising Center (UAC)
stops.subtitle: Academic planning + guidance
stops.description: Houses university leadership offices and key administrative services. The Undergraduate Advising Center (UAC) supports general education planning and graduation advising.
stops.address: Administration Building, San Francisco State University

stops.title: J. Paul Leonard Library & Sutro Library
stops.subtitle: Study, tech lending, archives
stops.description: A major research and learning hub with study spaces, technology lending, archives, and digital media labs. The Sutro Library inside features rare books and historical materials.
stops.address: J. Paul Leonard Library, San Francisco State University

stops.title: The Quad
stops.subtitle: Central campus green
stops.description: A central green space for studying, relaxing, and campus events. Students gather here between classes and during celebrations throughout the year.
stops.address: Quad, San Francisco State University

stops.title: Cesar Chavez Student Center
stops.subtitle: Student life hub
stops.description: Central hub for student life with dining options, lounges, student organization offices, meeting rooms, and the bookstore. Many campus events take place here.
stops.address: Cesar Chavez Student Center, San Francisco State University

stops.title: Creative Arts Building
stops.subtitle: Music + Theatre & Dance
stops.description: Home to the School of Music and the School of Theatre & Dance with performance venues like McKenna Theatre and rehearsal studios for hands-on learning.
stops.address: Creative Arts Building, San Francisco State University

stops.title: Fine Arts Building
stops.subtitle: Cinema, art, design
stops.description: Home to Cinema, Art, and Design with screening rooms, studio spaces, and digital media labs. Students develop creative skills through hands-on production.
stops.address: Fine Arts Building, San Francisco State University

stops.title: Marcus Hall
stops.subtitle: BECA media production
stops.description: Houses Broadcast and Electronic Communication Arts (BECA). Students gain hands-on experience in media production, broadcasting, and digital storytelling using pro-grade studios and labs.
stops.address: Marcus Hall, San Francisco State University

stops.title: Humanities Building
stops.subtitle: Poetry Center + languages
stops.description: Houses Liberal & Creative Arts departments including English, History, and Philosophy, plus the Poetry Center and American Language Institute.
stops.address: Humanities Building, San Francisco State University

stops.title: Monarca Dining Hall (City Eats)
stops.subtitle: All-you-care-to-eat
stops.description: One of the primary dining facilities offering all-you-care-to-eat meals with multiple stations, rotating menus, and options for various dietary needs.
stops.address: Monarca Dining Hall (City Eats), San Francisco State University

stops.title: West Campus Health & Dining
stops.subtitle: Gator Health Center + Yerba Buena Dining Hall
stops.description: The Gator Health Center provides medical care, labs, X-rays, and wellness resources for enrolled students (many services covered by the student health fee). Yerba Buena Dining Hall in the same building serves west campus housing communities with diverse meal options.
stops.address: Gator Health Center, San Francisco State University

stops.title: Mashouf Wellness Center
stops.subtitle: Fitness + recreation
stops.description: Comprehensive recreation and fitness facility with a climbing wall, indoor pool, track, weight rooms, and studios. Offers sports, group fitness, and wellness programming.
stops.address: Mashouf Wellness Center, San Francisco State University

tours.name: Full Tour (Includes Housing)
tours.description: Everything in Highlights + residence halls and apartment-style housing.

stops.subtitle: All-you-care-to-eat

stops.title: Mashouf Wellness Center
stops.subtitle: Fitness + recreation
stops.description: Comprehensive recreation and fitness facility with a climbing wall, indoor pool, track, weight rooms, and studios. Offers sports, group fitness, and wellness programming.
stops.address: Mashouf Wellness Center, San Francisco State University

stops.title: Towers at Centennial Square
stops.subtitle: First-year suite-style housing
stops.description: Suite-style housing primarily for first-year students. Residents share a common living space with semi-private bedrooms, building community during the first year.
stops.address: Towers at Centennial Square, San Francisco State University

stops.title: Village at Centennial Square
stops.subtitle: Apartment-style student housing
stops.description: Apartment-style housing for transfer, international, and continuing students. Furnished units support a more independent living experience while staying connected to campus.
stops.address: Village at Centennial Square, San Francisco State University

stops.title: Manzanita Square
stops.subtitle: Modern apartments near campus
stops.description: Apartment-style housing just steps from campus with residential units, retail spaces, and student lounges. Primarily serves upper-division and transfer students.
stops.address: Manzanita Square, San Francisco State University

stops.title: University Park North
stops.subtitle: Apartment living (transfer/continuing)
stops.description: Apartment-style housing for transfer and continuing students with shared kitchens and common areas, supporting independent living close to campus and Stonestown Galleria.
stops.address: University Park North, San Francisco

stops.title: University Park South
stops.subtitle: Apartment living (transfer/upper-division)
stops.description: Apartment-style housing for transfer and upper-division students with shared kitchen spaces and a more independent living environment near campus amenities.
stops.address: University Park South, San Francisco
